title: Webpage
description: Some normal DOM manipulation, and some OurJSEditor magic.
css:
html, body {\
    height: 100%;\
    width: 100%;\
    background: #4A7FB1;\
    display: block;\
    margin: 0;\
    padding: 0;\
}\
\
#display {\
    color: white;\
    font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif;\
    font-size: 30px;\
    position: absolute;\
    transform: translate(-50%, -50%);\
    font-weight: bold;\
}
js:
var el = document.getElementById("display");\
var angle = -Math.PI / 2;\
\
function update() {\
    el.style.left = Math.cos(angle) * 125 + window.innerWidth / 2 + "px";\
    el.style.top = Math.sin(angle) * 125 + 400 / 2 + "px";\
    angle += 0.02;\
}\
\
window.setInterval(function() {\
    update();\
}, 1000 / 60);\
\
window.addEventListener("resize", update);

title: P5.js Example Program
description: Coming from KA's Processing.js? Start here
css:
body {\
    width: 100%;\
    height: 100%;\
    margin: 0;\
    padding: 0;\
    overflow: hidden;\
}
js:
var displayText = "This is a basic set up template for anyone coming \\
from processing.js or Khan Academy looking to make new Processing programs on OurJSEditor\\
\\
There a few differences from Khan Academy. Instead of processing.js, \\
created by a KA employee and no longer updated, this uses p5.js, \\
the offical JS version of Processing.";\
\
function setup() {\
    // For now, width expands to fit the user's screen\
    // The height is fixed at 400\
\
    // After this the width and height variables work normally\
    var can = createCanvas(document.body.clientWidth, 400).canvas;\
    //Prevents right clicking from bringing up the context menu\
    can.addEventListener("contextmenu", e => e.preventDefault());\
\
    textFont("Tahoma");\
\
    background(255);\
}\
\
function draw() {\
    //Clear the screen if you right click\
    if (mouseButton === RIGHT) {\
        background(255);\
    }\
\
    //Draw a background box behind the text\
    stroke(0);\
    fill(255);\
    rect(0, 0, width-1, 100);\
    //Draw the text\
    fill(0);\
    noStroke(); //In p5.js text is affected by stroke\
    text(displayText, 10, 10, width-20, height);\
\
    //Draw some cool rounded rectangles when the mouse is pressed down\
    stroke(150, 0, 0);\
    fill(0);\
    if (mouseIsPressed && mouseButton === LEFT) {\
        rect(mouseX - 10, mouseY - 10, 20, 20, 10, 3, 10, 3);\
    }\
}

title: Blank Webpage
description: Just enough for you to start writing code.
css:
html, body {\
    margin: 0;\
    padding: 0;\
    width: 100%;\
    height: 100%;\
}

title: Blank P5.js Program
description: You know what's going on, and want to make a program with graphics.
